thread.title: Take a 360-degree tour of inside the world's most luxurious suites
thread.title_full: Take a 360-degree tour of inside the world's most luxurious suites | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey
title: Take a 360-degree tour of inside the world's most luxurious suites
text:
14 shares 13
View
comments
Take a look out at a stunning landscape view of New York from a penthouse apartment, wind down in a £14,000 aeroplane suite or relax on the outdoor deck of your ship suite.
Choosing just one of these to experience might possibly be one of the hardest decisions to reach.
Well now you can do all three - albeit from your computer.
Scroll down for video
The Four Seasons New York's Ty Warner penthouse offers panoramic 360-degree views of the New York City skyline from the terrace (right)
This is a stunning 360-degree virtual reality tour of some of the world's most extravagant accommodations - suites on a Singapore Airlines Airbus A380, Cunard's duplex stateroom aboard the Queen Mary 2 ocean liner and the Ty Warner Penthouse suite at the Four Seasons hotel in New York.
 Next Back on track: Nitama the cat becomes the new stationmaster... Getting away from it all... in 1948: The fascinating... Death of CAT that saved a Japanese railway line and became a... The experiences are so mesmerising you might even want to sip from your own Champagne flute as you kick back and take in the views.
Each space was extensively photographed using the Matterport Pro 3D camera by the Associated Press and then reconstructed for use in virtual reality. Users can 'walk' through and explore every part of these exclusive locations first-hand.
Four Seasons Ty Warner Penthouse - to see the interactive 360-degree version of this picture click here
From the seating area on the 52nd floor of the sprawling suite, the entire Manhattan skyline can be viewed
Guests can walk through the room's marble hallways, taking in sculptures and plenty of luxurious accents along the way
From the 52nd floor of this New York luxury hotel, guests are treated to panoramic 360 degree views of the city below.
The living room has hand-lacquered walls with mother of pearl inlay and its own fireplace. The library – larger than many Manhattan apartments – comes with a 26-foot high cathedral ceiling and a Bosendorfer grand piano.
The bedroom mattress was handmade in Sweden, taking 160 hours at a cost of $65,000. There’s even a room for private spa treatments or a quick workout.
Singapore Airlines Suites - to see the interactive 360-degree version of these pictures click here
Singapore Airlines customers who fly on the Airbus A380 (left) have the option to purchase 'suite class,' which includes lay flat beds (right)
The seat itself is three-feet-wide and faces a 23-inch television loaded with more than 100 movies and 180 television shows
When regular first class won’t do, there’s the suite class.
Top-paying passengers on this Airbus A380 will never have to worry about legroom again. Behind each set of sliding doors is a private oasis.
The seat is three-feet-wide and faces a 23-inch television loaded with more than 100 movies and 180 television shows. When it is time for sleep, flight attendants prepare a bed with linens and full-sized pillows. For couples traveling together, the two middle seats can combine into a double bed.
Queen Mary 2 Grand Duplex Suite - to see the interactive 360-degree version of these pictures click here

The stateroom on this Cunard vessel comes with personalised stationery, fresh fruit replenished daily and priority access
When it comes time to head to sleep, passengers will climb their private staircase to the second-storey bedroom
Passengers staying the two-level Queen Mary 2 Grand Duplex Suite can spread out on couches - and even relax on their own outdoor deck
The Queen Mary 2's Grand Duplex Suite ensures that no passenger will feel claustrophobic during the seven day trans-Atlantic crossing
There won’t be any feeling of claustrophobia during this seven day trans-Atlantic crossing.
Passengers can spread out on couches, relax on their own private outdoor deck – yes deck, not balcony – and escape upstairs to sleep.
There’s a walk-in wardrobe plus a butler to assist with unpacking. The stateroom on this Cunard vessel comes with personalized stationery, fresh fruit replenished twice a day and priority access on and off the ship.
Read more: Associated Press Interactive
